resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
nealrichardson opened a new pull request, #13407:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13407

   The `homebrew-r-brew` nightly job has been failing since the ARROW_GCS flag was turned on in [ARROW-14892](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14892). The failure is an undefined absl symbol
   
   ```
   ** testing if installed package can be loaded from temporary location
   Error: Error: package or namespace load failed for ‘arrow’ in dyn.load(file, DLLpath = DLLpath, ...):
    unable to load shared object '/Users/runner/work/crossbow/crossbow/arrow/r/check/arrow.Rcheck/00LOCK-arrow/00new/arrow/libs/arrow.so':
     dlopen(/Users/runner/work/crossbow/crossbow/arrow/r/check/arrow.Rcheck/00LOCK-arrow/00new/arrow/libs/arrow.so, 6): Symbol not found: __ZN4absl12lts_2021110210FormatTimeENS0_11string_viewENS0_4TimeENS0_8TimeZoneE
     Referenced from: /usr/local/opt/apache-arrow/lib/libarrow.900.dylib
     Expected in: flat namespace
    in /usr/local/opt/apache-arrow/lib/libarrow.900.dylib
   ```
   
   I encountered the same error when working on R bindings for GCS in [ARROW-16510](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16510). There are two issues:
   
   * The bundled abseil cmake build macro is incomplete, possibly as a result of a merge conflict
   * The homebrew formula should be updated to use the brew bottles for the google-cloud-cpp dependencies (there is no formula for it itself) rather than bundle everything

github-actions[bot] commented on PR #13407:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13407#issuecomment-1161855967

   :warning: Ticket **has not been started in JIRA**, please click 'Start Progress'.

github-actions[bot] commented on PR #13407:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13407#issuecomment-1161882838

   Revision: e9dc065ebcd47d619642f8118afda34d5b8f6871
   
   Submitted crossbow builds: [ursacomputing/crossbow @ actions-c454abbe7a](https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/branches/all?query=actions-c454abbe7a)
   
   |Task|Status|
   |----|------|
   |homebrew-r-brew|[![Github Actions](https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/workflows/Crossbow/badge.svg?branch=actions-c454abbe7a-github-homebrew-r-brew)](https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/actions?query=branch:actions-c454abbe7a-github-homebrew-r-brew)|

nealrichardson commented on PR #13407:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13407#issuecomment-1161923135

   Hmm, I think I was wrong about the diagnosis. The brew formula already depends on grpc, which pulls in abseil, and you can see abseil being installed by brew in https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/runs/6953742239?check_suite_focus=true#step:8:476. 
   
   Since abseil is working enough for grpc (assuming we test bundled grpc somewhere?) but not google-cloud-cpp, maybe we're missing something in INTERFACE_LINK_LIBRARIES in the bundled google-cloud-cpp cmake macro? 
   
   cc @kou

nealrichardson commented on PR #13407:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13407#issuecomment-1162456466

   Following https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13404#issuecomment-1162448555, I think we need `ABSEIL_SOURCE=BUNDLED` so that we get C++11 compatibility--brew builds for C++17.

kou commented on PR #13407:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13407#issuecomment-1162500923

   Sorry, I missed this in ARROW-14892.
   
   Could you try the following?
   
   ```diff
   diff --git a/dev/tasks/homebrew-formulae/apache-arrow.rb b/dev/tasks/homebrew-formulae/apache-arrow.rb
   index 94a1a67a1a..4908c22ed6 100644
   -

kou commented on PR #13407:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13407#issuecomment-1162501599

   FYI: `resolve_dependency_absl()` isn't related to this case because we don't use bundled Abseil in this case.

nealrichardson commented on PR #13407:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13407#issuecomment-1162532462

   > FYI: `resolve_dependency_absl()` isn't related to this case because we don't use bundled Abseil in this case.
   
   Yep, I was wrongly assuming that all of my "undefined symbols" problems were the same. I've bumped to C++17 here and reverted the cmake changes. Pushing on the static build issues in #13404.

github-actions[bot] commented on PR #13407:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13407#issuecomment-1162533128

   Revision: caf11481242097516eb04bd569135e7aafd31603
   
   Submitted crossbow builds: [ursacomputing/crossbow @ actions-a120875ba7](https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/branches/all?query=actions-a120875ba7)
   
   |Task|Status|

   |homebrew-r-brew|[![Github Actions](https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/workflows/Crossbow/badge.svg?branch=actions-a120875ba7-github-homebrew-r-brew)](https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/actions?query=branch:actions-a120875ba7-github-homebrew-r-brew)|

fields.description:
The {{homebrew-r-brew}} nightly job has been failing since the ARROW_GCS flag was turned on in ARROW-14892. The failure is an undefined absl symbol

{code}
** testing if installed package can be loaded from temporary location
Error: Error: package or namespace load failed for ‘arrow’ in dyn.load(file, DLLpath = DLLpath, ...):
 unable to load shared object '/Users/runner/work/crossbow/crossbow/arrow/r/check/arrow.Rcheck/00LOCK-arrow/00new/arrow/libs/arrow.so':
  dlopen(/Users/runner/work/crossbow/crossbow/arrow/r/check/arrow.Rcheck/00LOCK-arrow/00new/arrow/libs/arrow.so, 6): Symbol not found: __ZN4absl12lts_2021110210FormatTimeENS0_11string_viewENS0_4TimeENS0_8TimeZoneE
  Referenced from: /usr/local/opt/apache-arrow/lib/libarrow.900.dylib
  Expected in: flat namespace
 in /usr/local/opt/apache-arrow/lib/libarrow.900.dylib
{code}

I encountered the same error when working on R bindings for GCS in ARROW-16510. There are two issues:

* The bundled abseil cmake build macro is incomplete, possibly as a result of a merge conflict
* The homebrew formula should be updated to use the brew bottles for the google-cloud-cpp dependencies (there is no formula for it itself) rather than bundle everything
fields.summary: [C++] Fix bundled abseil and homebrew formula
